intro: Hymenodictyon biafranum, commonly known as the African starleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
